website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive stainless steel egg poacher pan that comes with non-stick egg cups.
pros: Can poach six eggs at a time
Each cup is coated with a non-stick finish to help the eggs slide out easily
You can use this as a 9-inch frying pan without the poaching attachments
Will work with an induction burner
cons: The size of these poaching cups creates a taller egg which doesn't work well for some recipes

customer_reviews.title: Great poacher!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to address some of the complaints in other reviews. 1. “Lid Doesn’t Fit Well”. Turn the handles of the individual cups towards the hole in the tray. The lip faces down. The lid will fit. 2. “Non-stick Issue”. Take a small baking spatula and go around a portion of the egg. It will slide out. Also use oil or butter to begin with. 3. “Cups are hard to remove”. See picture in my review. Lift the tray by the handle and place on surface of stove. The cups will pop up, and they’re easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: SWeigel

customer_reviews.title: Lid!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan according to the reviews. The lid is to small to fit over the egg pans by 3/8 of an inch. This is very disappointing. I am sending it back!!!!!!!!! If they get this problem solved I may buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: ODDBALL1958

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: Okay I wilk not try to be bias as i do understand that some products can come with issues. Ill consider my self the unlucky customer. First if all it is not a non stick i literally threw away 6 eggs because they all were stuck and came out looking deformed and in pieces. Also the cups are so small that if you use large eggs it can and will over flow. I am delicate with my cookware soo i have soft sponge and thats what i like to use so i did. The not stick (black part) literally scraped off as i was trying to remove the residue of the eggs that stuck to the cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Product!!!  Very Satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes perfect poached eggs! The eggs are perfect every time we use it. We used a sauce pan for soft boiled eggs but a lot of times the eggs are overcooked because you can only guess at the cooking time. The size of eggs are different. Medium, large or extra large eggs have different cooking times. Using this pan we can determine the consistency of the inside of the egg. We press on the egg slightly with a fork to determine the softness or hardness of the egg as it is cooking. Easy to clean the cups. Easy storage! I would highly recommend the product!
customer_reviews.author: Snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have been using this almost every weekend for a year and it has held up perfectly. Very easy to use, just add water and cook. You'll get the hang of how done you prefer your eggs, I prefer a runny yolk, which means the top should not be solid/have some movement, then my eggs are done. Easy to clean up also, the teflon hasn't deteriorated at all. Definitely recommend for poached eggs, works great. Update: Bought a second one of these for the fifth wheel. My wife and I are still eating eggs and grits for breakfast almost every weekend, can't live without this!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: A fine insturment for poached eggs
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for an egg poaching something to replace what we have been using for 15 years. Tried single cups, silicone things, pots of boiling water but nothing has made better eggs than this pan. Was going for the one that cooks 4 eggs but we always have more than 2 people for breakfast on Sundays. 6 eggs here and ready in minutes and easy to cook ( Really Easy ) suggest follow the directions
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good pan for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have no major complaints about this product. My husband likes it so much that he gave one to a relative for Christmas. The pan portion is lightweight so if you're wanting a serious quality, heavy duty pan comparable to high quality pots & pans then this is not your product. But it works well for its intended purpose so no complaints there. The only complaint I do have is that, although the egg cups are coated with non-stick material, you MUST remember to spray with oil before using. Otherwise you'll have quite a task ahead cleaning each little cup....I found out the hard way!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: New egg poacher used everyday!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the main pan gets spots from olive oil and it won't come out with soap and water - I have to clean it with vinegar and baking soda. I have never had this happen to a good stainless steel pan before! One of the egg cups has already cracked and the eggs aren't as easy to get out as I thought they would be! I do use it every day and always carefully hand wash to try to keep it new. Overall I wish the whole pan was of better quality .
customer_reviews.author: Jane Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Makes great eggs! Also...
customer_reviews.text: This is a gateway kitchen utensil! A woman mentioned to me that she likes eggs Benedict, so I bought this. Next thing I knew I also purchased a toaster and a blender. A 32oz bottle of lemon juice that I'll have for the rest of my life. Dijon mustard that I'll only use 1tbsp at a time for the next ten years. There are nine part of this that have to be washed after every use (pot, tray, lid, six cups), plus the blender jar, lid, plates, silverware. I'm not even mentioning the ridicule you'll receive from friends about your attempt to make hollandaise sauce (think: hollandaise drizzle). Trust me, just go to IHOP.
customer_reviews.author: SoxFanInPA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect egg pan
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for a gift for my husband and he loves it. Hes been looking for the perfect pan for a while and finally decided on this one. You get the perfect egg each time. Very easy to use, very easy to clean and love that you can remove each egg separate. I like mine cooked a little more than his so each egg being independent is great option
customer_reviews.author: BrittanyF

customer_reviews.title: It is though and I am very happy about that
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly surprised at how heavy this was. I expected normal heaviness and for the price I assumed it would not be necessarily made well. It is though and I am very happy about that. All of the little cups come out of the pan and so they can be washed separately. The egg cups are rounded bottoms and so the eggs tend to have more of a rounded shape coming out, but for benedicts, which is why I bought it, it works well. If in the event egg gets all over the cup holder, there is a handle that makes it lift easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good results
customer_reviews.text: The only modification I'd suggest is not to use oil in the pans if you expect the eggs to taste like authentic poached eggs. Because the traditional way is to boil them in water with salt and vinegar, you put a table spoon of water with a pinch of salt and several drops of vinegar into each pan instead of oil. Don't worry about eggs getting stuck, they come out even easier this way. Importantly, they taste more like poached eggs than boiled eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Yury Petrov

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The egg tray warped after a few uses to a degree that the lid no longer can hold in the steam.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: NO to stainless from now on...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but after one used the pan has burnt marked that can't be cleaned off plus water stains marked looks annoying that can't be rid of soap and water. I don't think they would even accept this if I return it.
customer_reviews.author: Gael

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I waited so long to buy one.
customer_reviews.text: It does feel a little light, so I might not choose this for a commercial kitchen, but for as often as I poach eggs, (a handful of times per month.) this will serve well for many years. I love that I can do six at once, though I have only once done so in three months. The lid does not make a great seal with the pan though. a lot of steam shoots out. A heavier lit might help with that. That's my only complaint. I was worried that grabbing the cups out would require tongs, but they are cool enough to handle. Just have to take the pan off the stove so the steam doesn't burn your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Satyr

customer_reviews.title: Eggsactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a poacher to replace the one I have used for years. Found this one with a Google search on Amazon and am delighted with it. Was concerned that a six-egg poacher might be unwieldy after the four-egg one I had; but no problem at all; and allows me to serve more people when they're around for breakfast. Good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Traub

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I see other reviewers have said "low quality" and I have to disagree with that. The pan itself is actually really decent. Here's the breakdown. Overall, the whole pan is quite heavy and therefore sturdy. The lid is a good quality and solid with weight to it. The egg cups themselves, are solid, non-stick and also have decent weight so as to make them non-flimsy. The bottom stainless steel, is surprising light. This is why I believe others have had issues with quality, but really, all fits together so well, that the other parts compensate for this lightness. All in all, one of the better poachers I've seen. So buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: GoGirlGo

customer_reviews.title: Easy cooking,  easy clean up.
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical after reading some reviews but my poached eggs were perfect. The eggs are very easy to remove from the cups and the entire pan cleaned up easily. I cooked the eggs four 4 minutes but I think next time I would go 3 1/2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: caryl b

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING ; egg cups ARE NOT STICK FREE
customer_reviews.text: While the dark finish inside looks like teflon, it is NOT. Must grease the cups first. and eggs really stick to the coating. Had a heck of a time cleaning the. Must use a plastic scouring pad. Knowing this, I would have just got a stainless set; don't know what the coating is and not sure it is good for u. REPEAT; NOT NON STICKING; FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.author: Truthseeker

customer_reviews.title: VERY WELL MADE !
customer_reviews.text: This is Very well made....a nice heavy pan that does exacty what it is suppose to do....You will never need another one...This is going to last you a lifetime if you take good care of it....You won't be sorry....it is GREAT !!
customer_reviews.author: To The Moon And Back...

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected🤓😁
customer_reviews.text: Much better than expected, heavier construction, fit & polish, copper clad(?). Previous poacher were cheap (thin) aluminum? A:k/a chap. This is Versatile can be used as additional sauce pan. This was purchased for my daughter; I purchased a four cup poacher for myself.
customer_reviews.author: DHG

customer_reviews.title: it works great.
customer_reviews.text: The removable egg holders work very well. The pan itself is lacking quality. Mine discolored after the first use. Not a big deal, since it is only boiling water. I do wish the egg holders were of larger diameter, so eggs were not as thick. Overall, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike - Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: The design of this is very poor. The little rings don’t sit well in the openings, and the cups don’t sit well in the openings. When you put the lid on, they need to move around or otherwise they hit the lid. Very odd design.
customer_reviews.author: Alyn York

customer_reviews.title: EGGSTRA PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: How much can you say about an egg poacher? Plenty, if it is this one! After looking at all available, THIS one works the best for us. I love that it holds up to six eggs, not four. The cups are coated so the eggs don't stick. It is recommended that you coat them slightly with some oil or marg, or butter so I just take a paper towel, moisten one spot with veg oil and swipe the cups with that. I would recommend filtered or bottled water ONLY if you have HARD water like we do. Cooks perfectly every time! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Diane E Kimbell

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the little egg cup holders. They don’t sit completely and the egg cup can slide out if not careful. Overall a great product and it’s honesty perfect for poaching eggs. Makes it so simple and quick to make poach eggs.
customer_reviews.author: mike knows best

customer_reviews.title: better breakfast.
customer_reviews.text: works great. with a little spray oil, egg does not stick in the little bowl at all. We were poaching directly in the bowling water before, and this is waaayyyy better. And it makes it easy to get 6 eggs cooked exactly the same, since you can load the tray on the counter, then transfer to the pan to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Lazy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and found a new use too!
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I just totally LOVE poached eggs but occasionally I do. It's just myself and hubby and we certainly don't need 6 poached eggs at one time. Well, I solved two problems with this pan. I hate to peel hard boiled eggs so when I cook all six eggs I just cook them longer till they are done-done. OILA! They slide right out and ready to chop for salads etc. HA! No more badly peeled eggs, no more cussing and swearing at egg shells that won't come off. Plus the pan is actually pretty nice. Well made and the lid fits other pans I have too. It was a win-win with this item all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.featherpicker

customer_reviews.title: Poached eggs well
customer_reviews.text: It cooks poached eggs well. I do add butter even though the cups are nonstick, it makes them easier to get put. I thought the price was a was a little high but I needed an egg poacher.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Works on Induction Cooktop!
customer_reviews.text: This does work on an induction cooktop. I read reviews that stated it would work and it does. It is lightweight and we always coat the cups with a bit of butter so the eggs slide right out. It's a great little set ...so glad we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Definately not all clad durability but low cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a very, very light weight stainless steel pan. I am concerned it will warp easily with heat. Good thing I don't have a smooth top stove as it is uneven just sitting on the counter top. It only needs to boil water. This pan can clearly not be used for much else. All components are very thin and bendable. Guess you get what you pay for this was very cheap and the pan is the same.
customer_reviews.author: NW reader

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. The eggs come out great. Tried some with Nothing, some with Butter and some with Oil. For all of them at the end you need to take the lid off and give them a minute to sit before they come out. They don't quite slide out but come out with a little nudge. The shape of the eggs don't look restaurant but they are consistent in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Not for keeps.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job at poaching eggs. I wouldn't use the skillet for any other purpose as it is very lightweight and probably does not heat evenly. The tray that holds the cups is made of a cheap, filmsy metal and warps with time. After that, it does not sit flush into the pan, and the lid does not sit flush with the tray.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: Actually I’ve had several of these for different homes. Since I needed one lost cup for my 6 poacher. I found it cheaper to just get the larger poacher. Love it. Works fine. Nice weight.
customer_reviews.author: R Vancleve

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: heck just a little common since and you'll be using this in know time , had it for 3 days now and i use it every morning . i rate this a ( 10 ) !!!
customer_reviews.author: steve lang

customer_reviews.title: Terrific improvements to a wonderful egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific item if you like poached eggs and the improvements that the company made to the poacher has made it that much easier to use. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Efriam ben Yisrual

customer_reviews.title: handle snaps off, the spot welds are defective
customer_reviews.text: This poacher has been used twice in the last year or so and at the very next attempt to use it, the handle drops off. Clearly a defective product. Go for the models with the boats all the way through, these spot welds are not reliable and tend to be defective. I would strongly suggest you check out other models unless you like throwing your money away.
customer_reviews.author: SimonPT

customer_reviews.title: After all these years of trying to perfect Eggs Benedict the old fashioned way
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and couldn't wait to try it out. After all these years of trying to perfect Eggs Benedict the old fashioned way, I aced it with this on my first attempt. Toasted English Muffins in the broiler, slice of Canadian Bacon, Knorr's Hollandaise Sauce and my new pan - perfection in less than 15 minutes! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie V

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Trying to figure out how to write to seller. My pan has spots. Not water spots. Not sure what it is. I just got 2 days ago. Cups are a little small, but workable
customer_reviews.author: Missrobyn

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Makes poaching eggs very easy. I did not use cooking spray and the eggs were a little hard to get out but it still worked. I will use the spray or butter next time. Please note that some components are very sharp and I cut myself pretty deep while washing it.
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Good set - Not for induction
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new egg poacher and this looked like a good one to try. We have an induction cooktop and there were indications that this pan would work with induction. Not the case. Could not get it to work. So sending it back. I will say that the quality of the set looked very good. Sorry it didn't meet our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: As described and as expected
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it does and I expected. It is quite lightweight which isn’t a problem only because it is just boiling water. Using for other things would scorch the pan. Overall I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl rader

customer_reviews.title: The most, the best and the easiest egg poacher!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this egg poacher!!! My hubby and I love poached eggs, and this is the one that poaches the most the best and easiest stove poacher!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ann Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for poaching eggs.
customer_reviews.text: I use it only for poaching eggs. The height of the sides makes it a little harder to use for frying or sautéing than my regular cookware. Other than that it a good addition to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Gallus

customer_reviews.title: Happiness is a perfectly poached egg.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made product and makes perfect poached eggs. I particularly like the glass top and the little handles on the poachers. On my first use, I left the eggs in for about 5 minutes and that might have been just a little too long. Oh no.. I will have to use it again and again and again to find the perfect timing. :-)
customer_reviews.author: TOKitt

customer_reviews.title: Good pan!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan for poaching eggs. All stainless so it will last for years. Glass lid for easy viewing while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Thewalls

customer_reviews.title: Easy eggs, soft or hard boiled!
customer_reviews.text: I use this item to boil eggs. I hate having to peel the shell from boiled eggs. This worked perfectly! Very easy to clean and easy to use. I would definitely recommend. Great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Carol F.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing out there!
customer_reviews.text: This pan works really well. When we make porched eggs, we wipe a bit of coconut oil in the little pans before we put eggs inside. We've tried without oil yet. The eggs come out easily with no or little tiny bit of egg left behind. We let the water boil, then we cook the eggs in with a lid covered and leave it for 4 minutes on low/medium fire. The eggs come out nicely soft and cooked (egg white completely cooked and yoke partly cooked). Cleaning is really eas
customer_reviews.author: Ratana KM

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Work better than I had hoped The only real down side is the holders to lift the cups with. Over all happy with the quality
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Go for the more expensive
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Burned after grabbing the handle and after grabbing the lid. Cups for the eggs are too small.
customer_reviews.author: jake ohl

customer_reviews.title: Gets rusty quickly
customer_reviews.text: All 6 egg poaching mini bowls rust quickly. Didn’t last long once I started using it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, metal insert not flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, metal insert not flimsy. saucepan is a nice weight stainless steel. Followed directions, lightly buttered the non-stick cups to season, eggs were perfect for me after 4 1/2 minutes. Looking forward to making Eggs Benedict soon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Hof

customer_reviews.title: Works as stated, not as one would want
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly serviceable pan, though slightly less quality in materials then what picture portrays. Some may like their poached eggs this way. The size of the poaching cup created a thicker white to egg, and less soft, not "restaurant" results. The egg took some coaxing to get out of the non-stick cup.
customer_reviews.author: Chestatee J

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without this!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this almost daily. We LOVE it!! I only wish it was bigger so we could make more eggs at a time haha!! We have a big family so many days I cook up two batches for breakfast. I can't believe we ever made breakfast without this!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: We eat a lot of poached eggs in our house & this pan makes it a breeze to make them & clean up! Bonus that it looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: M. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: So easy to make a cheat-poached egg. Times saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. I am a traveling nurse so I have one for "home" and one when I travel. Perfect for me! I cook all six eggs and meal prep for three shifts! Two of my friends ordered them too! Saves so much time and frustration from truly poaching my eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I cant get the shells off boiled eggs no matter WHAT recipe I use.. so i hard cook my eggs and then use these for deviled eggs... time saver - coat with a little coconut oil and they pop right out
customer_reviews.author: mary burnette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean. Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Easy to make poached eggs, I've also made quick egg custard with it
customer_reviews.author: GouldBG

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy poacher
customer_reviews.text: This poacher is heavy stainless with a glass top. Having 6 cups is great when there are several people. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cook evenly
customer_reviews.text: My family of 5 can eat a lot of eggs. They really like poached eggs. In the interest of time I thought this would be s great time saver but I have found that with this big size they just don't cook evenly. Some will be well done and others will be barely done. I have a gas stove. It's also time consuming to wash with all the parts that go with it.
customer_reviews.author: BMay

customer_reviews.title: Good poacher
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job. I use my Westbend timer and set it for 5 or 51/2 minutes depending on the size eggs I'm cooking. I get the water boiling and have my eggs already to go in the poacher and set the timer, put the rack of eggs in, close the lid and wait for the timer. Only one complaint. The pan is so light weight and the bottom is not flat' so the pan sets their and rocks as it cooks. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Good little pan
customer_reviews.text: For someone who loves poached eggs like me, this is a nice gift. It does cook 6 eggs instead of the standard 5, but just slightly smaller. There are a lot of pieces and the pan itself is very light weight, but has seemed to hold up just find so far. The little cups (inserts) can get scratched so be careful. Makes sure to use butter in the cups (and not pam spray) or you may end up with bubbly egg whites.
customer_reviews.author: ashell

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you like poached eggs.
customer_reviews.text: It is good quality. So much better than what I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I love that it cooks 6 eggs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I love that it cooks 6 eggs, most poachers only cook one or four. Stainless steel is the way to go, we try to avoid aluminum, but the non-stick coating is an aluminum product, so there's why I only gave it 4 stars. I'm sure it could warp easily, but we didn't put it in the dishwasher or cook on high heat, so not sure. The glass lid helps tremendously to keep an eye on the eggs.
customer_reviews.author: dkelley

customer_reviews.title: Six at once.
customer_reviews.text: I love this new poacher, I've had a 3 cup poacher for 2 years and my hubby likes 3 eggs for breakfast. So I either had to wait until his were done then start over or fry my eggs. This beautiful pan is a real time saver, it looks great, works terrific and cleans up in a snap. Love this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it Non-stick bowls were great
customer_reviews.text: The eggs came out perfectly!!! Love it Non-stick bowls were great. This is eggactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Bob McCranie

customer_reviews.title: Best Eggs Benedict with this pan!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, great instructions and made the best filet mignon eggs benedict with this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Freeland

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't fit pan
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the package and the lid is too small for the pan. Am sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Tree tops

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife a few months ago. It’s easy to use and the eggs come out great every time.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Phil G.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product! Perfectly poached eggs in no time at all. Easy to use, very well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than a 4 or small egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Eggs for the whole family at once. . . Better than a 4 or small egg cooker. . . Don't need 6 today, no problem just put eggs in the cups you need.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best egg poacher ever
customer_reviews.text: Finally an egg poacher that's great! No sticking. Or losing half your egg when removing . Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Caroll

customer_reviews.title: Completely happy with our poacher
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this poacher and my wife is very impressed with it. It works great and the eggs look perfect when done. The weight of the pan itself is light but most poachers are. It was so easy to use and very easy to clean. We definitely would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Been trying to find one for ages and have used it every weekend since we got it.
customer_reviews.author: sue cleek

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a 3 egg poacher that had a solid top so you with fixed 3 eggs or need to add water to the empty ones. Not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Trent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to ise
customer_reviews.text: Makes 6 perfectly poached eggs at once. This is so much easier than the silicone cups that I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Philter

customer_reviews.title: Excelsteel 18/10 not as good quality as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: The 6 Non stick egg cups are fantastic! The pan itself is not the quality I thought it would be. The weight of the pan is like an aluminum pan, not stainless steel. Also, from some research I did, the Excelsteel 18/10 was supposed to be able to work on an induction cooktop. A magnet will NOT stick to the pan so I doubt it will work on an induction cooktop. Overall usage - on a regular stove it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jacalyn Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment With Condition on Arrival!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure who supplied this product to (or through) Amazon but it came with some dents in the side of the boiling pan. I was disappointed with the condition it arrived in. It looked like it had been repackaged (returned at least once before). I needed this for the diet I was on and it worked so I decided to keep it, however, I would not purchase through here again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this six-egg poacher because I can cook a half dozen eggs at once and store them. I no longer hardboil eggs for meals or salads. Instead poach them and store in a container. No more peeling! Superfast and no mess.
customer_reviews.author: SR in Idaho Falls

customer_reviews.title: Good but eggs will stick if you don't spray the cups
customer_reviews.text: This is thin and light weight but appears to be pretty good construction. The cups look like they are non-stick but don't count on them not to stick. You will need to spray the cups or add some butter before you add the eggs, otherwise the eggs will stick. I haven't owned any other egg poachers so I can't really compare but this appears to be good, not great.
customer_reviews.author: John Zornes

customer_reviews.title: It's Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to make perfect poached eggs, easy to clean and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Venita B.

customer_reviews.title: When using, spray the egg cups with a little nonstick spray, or use a little butter.
customer_reviews.text: The item works pretty much as described. I'm satisfied with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: shooter1

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty pan!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pan!! Very heavy duty and easy to use. Extremely easy to clean as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is not well made. I returned it and went back to making my poached eggs the old-fashioned way.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Z.

customer_reviews.title: 3 months still works great
customer_reviews.text: Used almost daily for 3 months and it still not sticking. Eggs slide out from the cups intact. I do use cooking spray and clean with warm soapy water and a sponge after each use. I use a silicone spatula to scoops the eggs out of the cups. Perfect poached eggs every time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooker
customer_reviews.text: Makes great poached eggs with little cleanup and does it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark107

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love my egg poaching pan! It poaches up to seven eggs, with non-stick coated cups. Easy to clean, nice weight stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great poached eggs!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Be sure to use butter before and let it melt... it keeps the eggs from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce T.

customer_reviews.title: A good gift.
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than expected and kind of hard to clean the bottom. But otherwise happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea stairs

customer_reviews.title: Too big and heavy
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a good product, but I was looking for a 4-cup and didn't see any on Amazon. The only one we saw was the 6-cup. It is made well, but very heavy to lift and I never use but 3 of the cups so it is very cumbersome for me to handle. Now that I have this one, I see you now have exactly what I wanted - but when I wanted it, you didn't have it.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Lynch Music

customer_reviews.title: Eggcellent
customer_reviews.text: Love poached eggs. This cooker makes it easy to cook them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Peel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Poacher
customer_reviews.text: I've shopped around looking for an egg poacher for a while and am glad I found this. The poacher is made well, cooks perfectly, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who is shopping for a good egg poacher. Makes awesome Eggs Benedict.. I'm 100% please with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Mama

customer_reviews.title: Poor shipping
customer_reviews.text: This a great product but the shipping was very poorly done. The box is completely dented because it came only in its original box vs an outside amazon box for protection. This was a gift for a friend so the box is not useable as well as it has our shipping labels on it. Very poor shipping!! Glad the pan and glass lid was not broken.
customer_reviews.author: MGregoire

customer_reviews.title: Great little poaching pan!
customer_reviews.text: Great little poaching pan! Makes the perfect egg every time!
customer_reviews.author: Ksquared

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price, we are loving our poached eggs
customer_reviews.author: Jane Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Eggs stick bad!
customer_reviews.text: The non stick isn’t great. Spray well with non stick spray
customer_reviews.author: MRS HOLLY A BOWLER

customer_reviews.title: Looks good on your stovetop.
customer_reviews.text: This egg poacher works... it poaches eggs. Just as I expected it to. It IS easy to clean and is better than the 50 year old poacher it replaced. Will it last 50 years? I'll let you know in 2069.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pan works great. My grandmother used to have one exactly like this and I was looking for one just like hers. Easy to use and eggs turn out great!
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift, great breakfasts
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our daughter and son-in-law for Christmas. We have a very old egg poacher and they often said they and the grand children love the poached eggs we fix when they visit. Anyway, they recently told us that it's the most-used Christmas present they received.
customer_reviews.author: FJB

customer_reviews.title: egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the poacher insert...they're too difficult to remove and you wind up burnng yourself. I expected all stainless with better handles to remove from the pan. The cups were too small, also.....because of being six; but then they should have made the pan larger.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Caforio

customer_reviews.title: 6 at once yeah
customer_reviews.text: I can poach 6 eggs at once. Great for eggs Benedict brunch
customer_reviews.author: SK16117

product_meta.title: ExcelSteel Non Stick Easy Use Rust Resistant Home Kitchen Breakfast Brunch Induction Cooktop Egg Poacher, 6 Cup, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1| Size:6 CupThis 18/10 stainless steel egg poacher with non-stick coated egg cups, is perfect for preparing that Sunday brunch. Invite your friends and family over for perfectly cooked eggs in all styles. Features stay cool handle and knob and a vented glass lid for easy monitoring. All in one 7.5" lidded frypan.
feature_bullets: Constructed in stainless steel for durability
Nonstick coated egg cups for easy extraction of eggs
